dose.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take
dose.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Start with a low dose and increase it.
Never exceed the recommended dose of painkillers.
dose.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an amount of something that you do or experience at one time, especially something unpleasant
dose.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I quite like Jamie in small doses  (=in limited amounts but not a lot or often).
Dave had a bad dose of flu.
dose.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: High doses of the drug can have bad side effects.
Treatment should be started with a small dose.
The study shows that a daily dose of aspirin may reduce the risk of developing bowel cancer.
The current recommended dose is 250 mg a day.
She took a lethal dose of painkillers.
The medicine is given as a single dose.
He had taken his usual dose of sleeping pills.
A nurse came in to give me a dose of antibiotics.
You should take care not to exceed the recommended dose of paracetamol.
dose.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to give someone medicine or a drug
dose.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Sumi dosed herself up with aspirin and went to bed.
